    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
Real Madrid hosted Leganes in a La Liga clash at the Santiago Bernabéu, a match that turned out to be a thoroughly dominant display by the hosts. The game kicked off with Real Madrid in possession, and right from the get-go, tensions ran high. Within the first ten seconds, a foul from Leganes set the tone for the match. Real Madrid quickly capitalized on the indirect free-kick, showing their intent early on.

Despite some back-and-forth play and periodic clearances, it was obvious that Leganes were struggling to contain Real Madrid’s relentless pressure. Frequent disruptions characterized the opening minutes with throw-ins and balls going out of play, indicating a scrappy, hard-fought duel. Just after the fourth-minute mark, Leganes managed a clearance but remained on the back foot as Real Madrid maintained their aggressive stance.

By the seventh minute, things took a turn as Leganes committed another foul, this time resulting in a yellow card. Real Madrid used their subsequent indirect free-kick to press deeper into Leganes' half. Even though the match saw several interruptions with the ball continuously going out of play, Real Madrid’s dominance was slowly becoming evident.

As the match progressed, Leganes tried to recover possession but struggled to break through Real Madrid’s defense. Clearances by both teams ensued, yet Real Madrid seemed more composed and strategic. Leganes were penalized again for their aggressive play when another foul in the eleventh minute resulted in another indirect free-kick for Real Madrid.

Halfway through the first half, the narrative remained the same – Leganes seemed intent on breaking Real Madrid’s flow with fouls and tight defensive play. However, their strategy backfired when Real Madrid undeniably caught their rhythm. A throw-in by Real Madrid around the twelfth-minute marked another phase of their relentless attack. As the minutes ticked by, Real Madrid's composure in exploiting set-pieces from throw-ins became clearer.

Tensions flared, with yellow cards shown to both teams. Real Madrid was cautioned in the sixteenth minute, signifying the rugged nature of the encounter. The game was characterized by numerous throw-ins suggesting that Leganes were almost in a damage control mode, trying to regain their footing with clearances and defensive plays.

Despite some attempts from Leganes to push forward, Real Madrid's defense held firm, while the attack, led by slick passes and strategic throw-ins, slowly dismantled their opponents' composure. Just before the twentieth-minute mark, another foul by Leganes provided Real Madrid yet another opportunity through an indirect free-kick. This constant breaking of play underscored Leganes’ tactical fouling approach.

The relentless Real Madrid attack finally bore fruit as the half approached its third quarter. After another period of throw-ins, clearances, and fouls, Real Madrid's superior play quality became increasingly evident. Around the thirty-second minute, Leganes were caught offside, and Real Madrid seized the opportunity for another indirect free-kick. Their persistence was rewarded when they made their first breakthrough in the thirty-eighth minute with a goal. The stadium erupted as fans celebrated Real Madrid's well-earned lead. Following the goal, Leganes kicked off, trying to reset their game plan.

Adding to Leganes’ woes, Madrid again found the net just before halftime in stoppage time. Real Madrid's clinical execution ensured that they headed into the break with a solid 2-0 lead, putting immense pressure on Leganes to rethink their strategy for the second half.

The second half commenced with Real Madrid determined to build on their lead. Leganes tried to regroup, but Real Madrid's high-intensity play continued. Early minutes of the second half saw more of the same as Real Madrid dominated possession and continuously exploited Leganes' weak points. Within the first three minutes, Leganes were forced to defend desperately against multiple shots on target.

Real Madrid's precision and discipline paid off yet again in the fifty-fourth minute. They extended their lead to 3-0, effectively sealing the match, barring any miraculous comeback from Leganes.

The game's physicality was undeniable, with Leganes receiving multiple yellow cards for persistent fouling. Substitutions commenced around the ninth and sixteenth minutes, with both teams seeking fresh legs to change the game's dynamics, but Real Madrid held firm.

By now, the rhythm was heavily tilted in favor of the home side, punctuated by strategic substitutions while control lay comfortably in their grasp. Leganes attempted to claw back but found their efforts fruitless against a resolute Real Madrid defense.

Despite the sizeable lead, Real Madrid continued their onslaught, attempting shots on target and remaining sharp defensively. Leganes managed to get some shots off target, but their inability to convert them highlighted their struggles.

As the match wore on, it summed up to back and forth between the midfields, several clearances, and desperate defending from Leganes. The approach from Leganes, more often than not, ended in fouls, and Real Madrid took full advantage with precise indirect free-kicks. Real Madrid’s craft in set-pieces and throw-ins displayed a side well-versed with exploitation of opportunity, regardless of minor disruptions.

In the dying moments of the game, the narrative hadn’t shifted. Real Madrid kept the momentum while Leganes strived to at least change the scoreline respectably. A flurry of set-pieces from Real Madrid tested the Leganes defense, but the visitors made sure not to extend their concession.

The game's conclusion was fitting – a dominant Real Madrid victory underscored by clear superiority in all departments. Leganes, despite their effort, couldn’t find a touch to convert their reduced opportunities. The stadium roared in acknowledgment as Real Madrid secured a well-deserved 3-0 victory, further solidifying their standing in La Liga.

The match would be remembered for its intensity and the sheer dominance of Real Madrid, both defensively and offensively. The visitors, Leganes, left the pitch humbled but with lessons learned from facing a top-caliber team that punished their every mistake while showcasing splendid football.
